active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains how to query apt/yum/dnf logs for suspicious packages (e.g., using grep for timestamps or awk for parsing), then the partner teaches it back with a 3-question quiz on sample logs.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a mock /var/log/apt/history.log with a malicious pip install embedded (e.g., timestamped 'install python-malicious-package'), reconstruct the attack timeline, propose mitigations (e.g., package allowlisting), and role-play presenting findings to an IR team.

distractor_protocol.step: Plausible but incorrect: e.g., wrong log path (/var/log/apt.log instead of history.log), similar package managers (npm vs apt), common errors (grep 'apt' vs 'install').
Misconceptions: Assume all distros log identically; overlook journalctl; ignore rotation/tampering.
Variety: 1 factual error, 1 partial truth, 1 unrelated.
Balance: 60% Q&A, 40% MCQ; cover all objectives/layers.
